alert.note: Alert for Kodiak Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 4:10PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... Strong northwesterly winds have resuspend ash from the 1912 Katmai-Novarupta eruption. The communities of Kodiak, Port Lions, and Ouzinkie are most likely to be impacted. As of 4 PM, satellite imagery still shows ash extending from the Katmai volcano complex to the northern half of Kodiak Island and most of Afognak Island. The ash looks to be diminishing this past hour, but is still present. The resuspended ash is expected to settle out of the atmosphere as winds come down throughout the evening. Those with respiratory ailments in these areas are encouraged to avoid or reduce outdoor activity to avoid inhaling the ash.
